intro: Jatropha yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan cupplant, is a shrub native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It features woody stems and produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it is often found in dry, rocky soils. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in arid environments. This species is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
